This is an interesting movie exploring the ideas surrounding volunteering perhaps for the army at the moment of going to war - versus wanting to stay behind in order to get married, or pursue other interests rather than risking life and limb in some war (Sudan in this case) which doesn't fully capture the imagination as a cause worth dying for - in order to motivate it would appear. (Leave the fighting to the more dispensable instead perhaps). A British man's fiancee and close friends declare him to be guilty of cowardice and each send him a white feather - meant to convey this message to him - as a result he seeks to redeem himself together with his sense of honour whatever the risk. thanks for seeding Michael Rizzo Chessman (moviesbyrizzo)
